active-directory.excerpt: This plugin enables authentication through Active Directory on Windows environment.
active-directory.name: active-directory
active-directory.title: Jenkins Active Directory plugin

assembla-auth.excerpt: This is an authentication and authorization plugin for assembla.com users
assembla-auth.name: assembla-auth
assembla-auth.title: Assembla Auth Plugin

async-http-client.excerpt: This plugin provides a shared dependency on the async-http-client library so that other plugins can co-operate when using this library.
async-http-client.name: async-http-client
async-http-client.title: Async Http Client

authorize-project.excerpt: Configure projects to run with specified authorization.
authorize-project.name: authorize-project
authorize-project.title: Authorize Project

cas-plugin.excerpt: This plugin enables use of Jasig CAS as an authentication source, for single sign-on and single sign-out support.
cas-plugin.name: cas-plugin
cas-plugin.title: CAS Plugin

cas1.excerpt: This plugin lets Hudson authenticate users via your organization's Central Authentication Service (CAS), for single-sign-on.
cas1.name: cas1
cas1.title: CAS protocol version 1 plugin

cloudbees-credentials.excerpt:
CloudBees Free Plugin
This plugin is used to manage credentials within Jenkins. This plugin is used by CloudBees plugins to access CloudBees services.
cloudbees-credentials.name: cloudbees-credentials
cloudbees-credentials.title: CloudBees Credentials Plugin

cloudbees-file-leak-detector.excerpt: This plugin is a sample to explain how to write a Jenkins plugin.
cloudbees-file-leak-detector.name: cloudbees-file-leak-detector
cloudbees-file-leak-detector.title: CloudBees File Leak Detector Plugin

cloudbees-folder.excerpt:
CloudBees Free Plugin
This plugin allows users to create "folders" to organize jobs. Users can define custom taxonomies (like by project type, organization type etc). Folders are nestable and you can define views within folders.
cloudbees-folder.name: cloudbees-folder
cloudbees-folder.title: CloudBees Folders Plugin

cloudbees-folders-plus.excerpt:
Jenkins Enterprise by CloudBees Plugin
This plugin provides additional enterprise ehancements to the free Folders plugin, including the ability to ensure that a slave will only build jobs from within defined approved folders.
cloudbees-folders-plus.name: cloudbees-folders-plus
cloudbees-folders-plus.title: CloudBees Folders Plus Plugin

cloudbees-ha.excerpt:
Jenkins Enterprise by CloudBees Plugin
This plugin eliminates downtime due to a Jenkins master crash due to a software or hardware failure. Administrators define a cluster of Jenkins masters with one acting as a primary. The plugin automatically detects failure on the primary and a backup quickly takes over.
cloudbees-ha.name: cloudbees-ha
cloudbees-ha.title: CloudBees High Availability Management plugin

cloudbees-license.excerpt:
CloudBees Free Plugin
This plugin provides licensing services for all the CloudBees licensed plugins.
cloudbees-license.name: cloudbees-license
cloudbees-license.title: CloudBees License Manager

cloudbees-monitoring.excerpt: This plugin provides metrics based monitoring for Jenkins.
cloudbees-monitoring.name: cloudbees-monitoring
cloudbees-monitoring.title: CloudBees Monitoring Plugin

cloudbees-nodes-plus.excerpt: This plugin adds enterprise extensions to the standard node functionality in Jenkins.
cloudbees-nodes-plus.name: cloudbees-nodes-plus
cloudbees-nodes-plus.title: CloudBees Nodes Plus Plugin

cloudbees-plugin-usage.excerpt: Summarizes usage of installed plugins insofar as that can be determined.
cloudbees-plugin-usage.name: cloudbees-plugin-usage
cloudbees-plugin-usage.title: CloudBees Plugin Usage Plugin

cloudbees-ssh-slaves.excerpt: This plugin provides an SSH Slaves connector based on Apache SSHd.
cloudbees-ssh-slaves.name: cloudbees-ssh-slaves
cloudbees-ssh-slaves.title: CloudBees SSH Slaves Plugin

cloudbees-support.excerpt: This plugin allows generation of a support request bundle that contains diagnostic information to aid     resolution of support requests.
cloudbees-support.name: cloudbees-support
cloudbees-support.title: CloudBees Support Plugin

cloudbees-update-center-plugin.excerpt:
Jenkins Enterprise by CloudBees Plugin
This plugin provides Jenkins with the ability to host update centers. Administrators can ensure that teams using Jenkins use "blessed" version of plugins and binaries. Update Centers can inherit from other update centers thus making it easier to share plugins/binaries across an organization. Administrators easily setup an Update Center by adding a new job type called "Update Center" and uploading the right artifacts.
cloudbees-update-center-plugin.name: cloudbees-update-center-plugin
cloudbees-update-center-plugin.title: CloudBees Update Center Plugin

credentials.excerpt: This plugin allows you to store credentials in Jenkins.
credentials.name: credentials
credentials.title: Credentials Plugin

crowd.excerpt: This plugin enables use of Atlassian Crowd as an authentication source.
crowd.name: crowd
crowd.title: Crowd Integration

crowd2.excerpt: This plugin enables use of Atlassian Crowd as an authentication source. It uses Crowd's REST API (available since Crowd 2.1) to access the services and supports single-sign-on.
crowd2.name: crowd2
crowd2.title: Crowd 2 Integration

delta-cloud.excerpt:
This plugin is a sample plugin to explain how to write a Hudson plugin.
NOTE: This cloud plugin has not been tested for compatibility with Jenkins Operations Center
delta-cloud.name: delta-cloud
delta-cloud.title: delta-cloud

description-setter.excerpt: This plugin sets the description for each build, based upon a RegEx test of the build log file.
description-setter.name: description-setter
description-setter.title: Jenkins description setter plugin

docker-plugin.excerpt:
This plugin allows slaves to be dynamically provisioned using Docker.
NOTE: This cloud plugin has not been tested for compatibility with Jenkins Operations Center
docker-plugin.name: docker-plugin
docker-plugin.title: Docker plugin

durable-task.excerpt: Library offering an extension point for processes which can run outside of Jenkins yet be monitored.
durable-task.name: durable-task
durable-task.title: Durable Task Plugin

ec2.excerpt:
WARNING: Initial testing results suggest this cloud plugin does not currently work with Jenkins Operations Center
This plugin integrates Jenkins with Amazon EC2 or anything implementing the EC2 API's such as an Ubuntu.
NOTE: This cloud plugin has not completed testing for compatibility with Jenkins Operations Center
ec2.name: ec2
ec2.title: Amazon EC2 plugin

git.excerpt: This plugin allows use of Git as a build SCM. A recent Git runtime is required (1.7.9 minimum, 1.8.x recommended). Plugin is only tested on official git client. Use exotic installations at your own risks.
git.name: git
git.title: Jenkins GIT plugin

git-client.excerpt: Shared library plugin for other Git related Jenkins plugins.
git-client.name: git-client
git-client.title: Jenkins GIT client plugin

github-api.excerpt: This plugin provides GitHub API for other plugins.
github-api.name: github-api
github-api.title: GitHub API Plugin

github-oauth.excerpt: Authentication of users is delegated to Github using the OAuth protocol.   Authorization is based on the characteristics of the users Github user data that is retrieved through the Github API (effectively as the authenticated user).
github-oauth.name: github-oauth
github-oauth.title: Github Authentication plugin

icon-shim.excerpt: This plugin allows other Jenkins plugins to take advantage of the <l:icon> tag.
icon-shim.name: icon-shim
icon-shim.title: Icon Shim Plugin

infradna-backup.excerpt:
Jenkins Enterprise by CloudBees Plugin
This plugin simplifies backing up Jenkins. Adminsitrators can now save hours by easily backing up and recovering from crashes using the backup. Users can easily create a new job type called "Backup" and back up build records, job and system configurations. The backups can be stored on a local machine or a sftp server. The plugin offers mutliple retention policies for the records such as keeping the last 'n' records, keep all backups or an exponential decay algorithm to save space.
infradna-backup.name: infradna-backup
infradna-backup.title: CloudBees Back-up Plugin

javadoc.excerpt: This plugin adds Javadoc support to Jenkins.
javadoc.name: javadoc
javadoc.title: Javadoc Plugin

jclouds-jenkins.excerpt:
This plugin uses JClouds to provide slave launching on most of the currently usable Cloud infrastructures.
NOTE: This cloud plugin has not been tested for compatibility with Jenkins Operations Center
jclouds-jenkins.name: jclouds-jenkins
jclouds-jenkins.title: Jenkins JClouds plugin

labmanager.excerpt:
This plugin provides a way to manage Virtual Machines that are controlled by VMware's Lab Manager product.
NOTE: This cloud plugin has not been tested for compatibility with Jenkins Operations Center
labmanager.name: labmanager
labmanager.title: Jenkins VMware Lab Manager Slaves plugin

ldap.excerpt: Security realm based on LDAP authentication.
ldap.name: ldap
ldap.title: LDAP Plugin

libvirt-slave.excerpt:
Add Libvirt Hypervisor slave support to Jenkins
NOTE: This cloud plugin has not been tested for compatibility with Jenkins Operations Center
libvirt-slave.name: libvirt-slave
libvirt-slave.title: Jenkins Libvirt Slaves plugin

mailer.excerpt: This plugin allows you to configure email notifications. This is a break-out of the original core based email component.
mailer.name: mailer
mailer.title: Jenkins Mailer Plugin

mapdb-api.excerpt: This plugin provides a shared dependency on the MapDB library so that other plugins can co-operate when using this library.

mapdb-api.title: MapDB API Plugin

maven-plugin.excerpt: Jenkins plugin for building Maven 2/3 jobs via a special project type.

WARNING: Initial testing results suggest this cloud plugin does not currently work with Jenkins Operations Center
{color:#333333}The {color}mesos-jenkins{color:#333333} plugin allows Jenkins to dynamically launch Jenkins slaves on a Mesos cluster depending on the workload\!{color}
NOTE: This cloud plugin has not completed testing for compatibility with Jenkins Operations Center

mesos.title: mesos

metrics.excerpt: This plugin exposes the Metrics API to Jenkins plugins.
metrics.name: metrics
metrics.title: Metrics Plugin

mock-security-realm.excerpt: Defines an insecure “security realm” only good for testing/demoing other parts of the system, such as authorization strategy.

mock-security-realm.title: Mock Security Realm

monitoring.excerpt: Jenkins' monitoring with JavaMelody. Open report after installation.
monitoring.name: monitoring
monitoring.title: Monitoring

mysql-auth.excerpt: This plugin enables authentication through MySQL.
mysql-auth.name: mysql-auth
mysql-auth.title: Hudson MySQL Plugin

nectar-license.excerpt:
Jenkins Enterprise by CloudBees Plugin
This plugin is used by CloudBees to give access to the Jenkins Enterpise by CloudBees plugins
nectar-license.name: nectar-license
nectar-license.title: Jenkins Enterprise License Entitlement Check

nectar-rbac.excerpt:
Jenkins Enterprise by CloudBees Plugin
The Role Based Access Control plugin gives a Jenkins administrator the ability to define various security roles that will apply to the system they administer. Once roles have been defined the Jenkins administrator can assign those roles to groups of users. The assignment of roles can take place either at the global level, or limited to specific objects within the system. And, additionally, the Jenkins administrator can even delegate the management of groups for specific objects to specific users.
nectar-rbac.name: nectar-rbac
nectar-rbac.title: CloudBees Role-Based Access Control Plugin

nectar-vmware.excerpt:
Jenkins Enterprise by CloudBees Plugin
This plugin lets you rent machines from VMWare vSphere installations to use as slaves. These machines act as "private cloud" for Jenkins to allocate jobs. The plugin recoganizes statically or dynamically (drop machines into folders) added machines. This results in an efficient usage of machines across an organization.
nectar-vmware.name: nectar-vmware
nectar-vmware.title: CloudBees VMWare Autoscaling Plugin

node-iterator-api.excerpt: This plugin provides support for iterating through all the Node instances that are in use by Jenkins, even those Node instances that are not traditionally attached to Jenkins. The API exposed by this plugin can be used by cloud provider plugins to identify unused provisioned resource.
node-iterator-api.name: node-iterator-api
node-iterator-api.title: Node Iterator API Plugin

openid.excerpt: This plugin enables user authentication via OpenID.
openid.name: openid
openid.title: openid

openid-server.excerpt: Turns Jenkins into an OpenID identity provider that allows other applications to authenticate users as Jenkins users
openid-server.name: openid-server
openid-server.title: CloudBees OpenID Server Plugin

openid4java.excerpt: This plugin provides a shared dependency on the openid4java library so that other plugins can co-operate when using this library.

This plugin integrates Jenkins with VirtualBox virtual machine.

wikitext.excerpt:
Jenkins Enterprise by CloudBees Plugin
This plugin lets you put wikitext instead of HTML in Jenkins descriptions fields. This is useful for organizations that are worried about XSS attacks on their publicly facing Jenkins instances.

wikitext.title: CloudBees WikiText Security Plugin
